actions-list.actionItem: The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 25, 2024, at 10:30 a.m.: That the Senate passed S. 2143, S. 2717, S. 2274, S. 3267, S. 3357, S. 3419, S. 3639, S. 3640, S. 3851, H.R. 292, H.R. 996, H.R. 2379, H.R. 2754, H.R. 3947, H.R. 3865, and H.R. 3944.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 23, 2024, at 9:45 p.m.: That the Senate agreed to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 815.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 23, 2024, at 2:03 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3687 and S. 3998. Appointment: United States Semiquincentennial Commission.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Adrian Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
